data.title: Post your death notices
data.meta_description: Ben, you are right about Johann Maier (from post #879) having an issue with a kidney! Gefallen: Seitengewehr Niere (Killed in action: Bayonet Kidney) Kind regards, Will.
data.text:
Gefallen: Seitengewehr Niere

And his family probably received the euphemism: died painless, as hero, by one shot through the heart.

I can imagine a bayonet through a kidney is a long and painful process

So sad, that poor generation.

Great work, thank you all for keeping up this small online altar as a reminder that war is not quite the solution for every conflict!

I will place a few other cards in future, that I have not seen here already. Although I still have to do a few pages.

Man, what a database...

Name: Siegfried Lohse

Date of birth: 18.7.1913

Place of birth: Floha

Death/missing date: 1.9.1939

Death/missing place: bei Mokra III

Gefallen: brustschuß im panzerwagen (chest shot in the tank)

An Unteroffizier in Stabskompanie der I./Panzer Regiment 35

Name: Werner Kaden

Date of birth: 24.12.1915

Place of birth: Floha

Death/missing date: 12.9.1939

Death/missing place: Lowicz

A Gefreiter in 1./Infanterie Regiment 102

Name: Willy Geißler

Date of birth: 6.9.1913

Place of birth: Floha

Death/missing date: 12.9.1939

Death/missing place: bei Matyldzin

Gefallen: infanterie geschuß lungenschuß (shot in the lung)

An Unteroffizier in 1./Infanterie Regiment 72

Name: Erwin Richter

Date of birth: 27.8.1910

Place of birth: Oederau

Death/missing date: 17.9.1939

Death/missing place: Lublin

Gefallen: infanterie geschuß brust (shot in the chest)

A Schütze in 2./Maschinengewehr Bataillon 7

Name: Rudi Scheithauer

Date of birth: 24.10.1918

Place of birth: Floha

Death/missing date: 19.4.1941

Death/missing place: angriff auf London

Cause of death as noted by Blackcat in post #884

An Obergefreiter in 1. Staffel der Kampfgeschwader 76

Name: Franz Mende

Date of birth: 22.12.1919

Place of birth: Chemnitz

Death/missing date: 12.12.1941

Death/missing place: 100km südlich Kreta Mittelländischer

A Feldwebel in Stabsstaffel der Kampfgruppe z.b.V. 300

This one is particularly interesting to me because this was a special transport unit using Ju 52. KG z.b.V. 300 had a Ju 52 coded (KB+HO) reported to be lost near Iraklion. All four crew members were missing. This was Feldwebel Franz Mende, Unteroffizier Kurt Hempel, Unteroffizier Rolf Hofmann, and Flieger Kurt Augustin. The unit was flying supply missions to North Afrika from the airfields on Kreta. This plane was lost over the sea after taking off from Iraklion and flying towards Derna in Libya.

This is also a special one to me: Gefreiter (!) Berno Heilig, Beobachter in a Sturzkampfgeschwader. He washed up on the Dutch shore of Noordwijk and was buried first at Katwijk, where I live. After the war he was reburried at Ysselsteyn, section TBB3-31.

A large card, glued to paper, and on the backside of the paper is a picture from Benno glued.

The family made a lot of work from the cards, this is not your average death notice. They all have a real photograph!

Full name: Berno Heilig

Born: 21 Mei 1921 Augsburg, Stadtkreis Augsburg, Bavaria, Germany

Died: 19 Okt 1942 (leeftijd 21)

Found: Noordwijk aan Zee, Noordwijk Municipality, Zuid-Holland, Netherlands. (His body washed ashore at Dutch coast near Noordwijk on 24/11/1942)

First buried: 29/11/1942 N.H.cemetery Katwijk

Reburied: 16/01/1952 Ysselsteyn Deutscher Soldatenfriedhof Ysselsteyn, Venray Municipality, Limburg, Netherlands

Lot TBB-3-31

Memorial place-ID 71375551

Plane data: JU088 A-4 werkenr: 142224.

Plane crashed into North-Sea.

Berno Heilig was on his second mission on enemy airspace.

Een herinnering aan een jonge vlieger - Katwijk in Oorlog

If any other information surfaces about Berno Heilig: my mates an me would be very interested!

I don't want to be impolite, but is there information to be found at Anchester? I was not aware of this possibility, but I got rather excited when I browsed through this section!

Click to enlarge the picture

Hi Martin.

Here is the casualty card for Berno -

Name: Berno Heilig

Rank: Gefreiter

Birth Date: 21 May 1921

Birth Plac: Augsburg

Military Unit: 6./Staffel Kampfgeschwader 6

Death Date: 19 October 1942

Death Place: Offküfte England, Feindflug Nordsee

Relative: Otto Heilig

His cause of death is noted as Feindflug (Combat flight)

MIA 19 October, 1942 with unnamed crew, cause unknown (Ju 88 Loss List). His Ju 88 crashed into the North Sea off the Dutch coast (DeSwart). Added: Remaining crew: Gefr B.Heilig, Obs (KIA, bur Yssel TBB-3-31, washed up at Noordwijk 11/24/42); Uggz G.Aisenpreis, R/O (MIA) and Gefr E,Sarfert, Gnr (MIA) (SGLO).

Kracker Luftwaffe Archive

More information -

Accident Junkers Ju 88 A-4 142224, 19 Oct 1942

Kind regards,

Will.
